{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3557982,"name":"","username":"JaxsonSP","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/48db29/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-16T00:41:34.668Z","cooked":"

As the title says when testing our robot we suddenly got an error we were not getting before we re-wired our canbus:

ERROR 4 [CAN SPARK] IDs: 3, 4, 5, 7, WPILib or External HAL Error: CAN: Message not found in periodic Status 2

I can see all the problematic IDs in the rev hardware client when plugged into the PDH so I am pretty sure there is no break in the CAN line, additionally non of these controllers are next to each other. All the controllers are on the newest firmware. There is only 13 things on the bus so I don’t believe that’s an issue. The only commonality I can find is that they all happen to be the controllers for the drive motors of our swerve drive, so I believe that its probably a problem in our code.

Here is our github: GitHub - Jaxson098/9019-2025: code for team 9019 2025 season
We are a python team and as I am new to FRC and our teams only coder I decided to just use the official robotpy/examples/SwerveBot code and try to convert it to work with our CAN SparkMax + CTRE CAN encoder setup. pretty much everything besides swervemodule.py and the network tables stuff is original and not mine so that should be fine. Otherwise I just set PID controller values to near zero while we troubleshoot.

I know its a lot to ask but if anyone could take a look at our swervemodule.py file I would really appreciate it, I have no idea what the issue could be. I cant start troubleshooting our MANY other issues that I will make a post about latter until this is solved.

There may be a CAN break between the Rio and the Spark Maxes. In that scenario the Rio would have a hard time seeing them, but plugging into the PDH (at the other end of the bus) might still be able to see the Spark Maxes

Use a multimeter to test your CAN rather than assuming based on the client. It sounds like the can bus is the issue. Make sure it’s terminating

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-03-16T04:23:15.696Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":53,"readers_count":52,"score":10.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":495731,"topic_slug":"getting-a-can-message-not-found-error-for-our-drive-motor-controler-ids","display_username":"Jared Van Horn","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51417,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Alum/NJIT Student"},"post_url":"/t/getting-a-can-message-not-found-error-for-our-drive-motor-controler-ids/495731/3","custom_user_title":"Alum/NJIT Student","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3558157,"name":"Alex","username":"ajs2","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ajs2/{size}/200927_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-16T05:51:38.749Z","cooked":"

Note that you can’t measure continuity or termination resistance while there’s data moving across the bus. When the robot is turned off, there should be about 60 ohms of resistance between any yellow point on the bus and any green point, and every point of the same color should be connected with no resistance.

Tested with a multimeter while the robot was off and there is resistance.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-03-17T23:05:01.365Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":24,"readers_count":23,"score":4.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":495731,"topic_slug":"getting-a-can-message-not-found-error-for-our-drive-motor-controler-ids","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":56260,"username":"ajs2","name":"Alex","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ajs2/{size}/200927_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":73437,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/getting-a-can-message-not-found-error-for-our-drive-motor-controler-ids/495731/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3559995,"name":"Ben Edwards","username":"beedward","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/beedward/{size}/111315_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-18T01:07:30.242Z","cooked":"

It needs to be the right resistance - 60 ohms pus or minus a bit. If it’s 120 one of your terminators is off or loose.
When the robot is on, are your spark maxes all blinking slowly magenta or cyan? If their leds are flickering instead of nice slow blinking it’s almost certainly a can problem. If only canh or canl is open somewhere, some messages may get through.
A question - are you using a canivore, by any chance? Unfortunately only ctre devices will work with that so i hope that’s not the case.

That was the issue, the terminator on our PDH was broken. Thanks so much!
